name: The Fusilli Jerry Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Mechanic.

	Throughout the rest of the series, Elaine has an on-and-off relationship with David Puddy (played by Patrick Warburton).  In this episode, she likes the fact that he always works with his hands and muscular arms, then he comes home ready to spend the night with Elaine.  Jerry dislikes the fact that although he and Puddy are friends, he never asked if he could date Elaine.

False.

	George and his mother have lunch at Monk's in the beginning of the episode and she tells George that she's getting an eye job because she's a divorcée.  George tells her that she's not a divorcée because she's only separated from Frank.  He gets Kramer to drive Estelle back from the hospital.

questions.text: What does Kramer get for his car in this episode?
questions.explanation:
New license plates.

	Kramer agrees to pick Estelle up from the doctor's, but he needs to pick up his new license plates first.  When he gets his plates, he ends up getting the wrong ones, and although he argues this with the woman behind the counter, he takes them and uses them anyways.

questions.text: How does Jerry's 'move' differ from Puddy's version?
questions.explanation:
Puddy uses 'The Pinch'.

	After talking with Jerry at the garage about Elaine, Puddy spent the night with her.  The next day, Jerry was shocked to find out that Puddy had used his move with Elaine.  Although Elaine doesn't mind it, Jerry feels like someone has been ripping him off.

questions.text: What is the name of George's girlfriend in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Nancy.

	George feels that his relationship with Nancy isn't working out because he doesn't seem to be doing well with her in bed.  He asks Jerry to give him a few tips and George puts them 'into the vault'.  Jerry has to make sure that his tips aren't passed along or else they'll end up like they did in the hands of David Puddy.

questions.text: What type of pasta does Kramer plan to use on George's pasta sculpture?
questions.explanation:
Ravioli.

	In his spare time, Kramer created a little sculpture out of fusilli pasta that resembles Jerry.  He says that it's difficult to find the right pasta for the right person because you need to capture their personalities.  Kramer chose fusilli for Jerry because he's 'silli'.

questions.text: After her operation, how long is Estelle not supposed to cry for?
questions.explanation:
Ten days.

	If Estelle cries during this time, the whole operation could be useless.  When Kramer comes to pick Estelle up at the doctor's, he parks in a doctor's spot and a security guard comes over.  Kramer gets out of the situation by pretending to be a proctologist.  When he shows the guard his license plates, he's let off the hook.

questions.text: How does Jerry get a real estimate on his car?
questions.explanation:
Through Elaine.

	After an argument with Puddy, Jerry takes his car back and it starts to get worse.  He takes it for an estimate, but he knows that it really doesn't cost $20,000 to fix his car.  He asks Elaine to ask Puddy about the car and she manages to slip all of the damages into her regular conversation.  It turns out that Jerry really was being cheated on his estimate.

questions.text: What is the name of Kramer's girlfriend in the end of this episode?
questions.explanation:
Sally.

	After introducing Fusilli Jerry to Elaine, Kramer comes out of his apartment and introduces Sally.  The only reason he goes out with Sally is to reflect his license plates (which aren't actually his).  Meanwhile, George tries 'the move' again and it works and Estelle and Frank argue that Kramer 'stopped short' while driving Estelle home.  'Stopping short' is actually Frank's move.

Frank.

	Nancy breaks up with George because he wrote the move on his hand, and Jerry goes back to Puddy.  Frank gets angry at Kramer and Frank accidentally falls and sits on Fusilli Jerry.  They're forced to go to the proctologist and Kramer finds out who has his license plates.  Estelle discovers what happened to Frank and she gets so worried that she cries and ruins her eye job.
